SEARCH
Package net.elena.murat.material

Class LambertMaterial

java.lang.Object
net.elena.murat.material.LambertMaterial
All Implemented Interfaces:
Material
public class LambertMaterial extends Object implements Material
LambertMaterial represents a matte, non-glossy surface that reflects light equally in all directions, using a simplified Phong-like model (ambient and diffuse components). It now fully implements the extended Material interface.

  • Constructor Details

    • LambertMaterial

      public LambertMaterial(Color color)
      Default constructor for LambertMaterial. Uses default ambient (0.1) and diffuse (1.0) coefficients.
      Parameters:
      color - The base color (diffuse color) of the material.

    • LambertMaterial

      public LambertMaterial(Color color, double ambientCoeff, double diffuseCoeff)
      Constructor to customize material coefficients.
      Parameters:
      color - The base color of the material.
      ambientCoeff - How much the material reacts to ambient light (0.0-1.0).
      diffuseCoeff - How much the material reacts to diffuse light (0.0-1.0).

  • Method Details

    • getColorAt

      public Color getColorAt(Point3 point, Vector3 normal, Light light, Point3 viewerPos)
      Calculates the material color at a specific point, considering the contribution of a single light source. This method applies ambient and diffuse lighting components.
      Specified by:
      getColorAt in interface Material
      Parameters:
      point - The intersection point in world coordinates.
      normal - The surface normal at the intersection point in world coordinates.
      light - The single light source to be used in the calculation.
      viewerPos - The position of the viewer (camera) in world coordinates (not directly used for Lambertian).
      Returns:
      The calculated color contribution.

    • getReflectivity

      public double getReflectivity()
      Returns the reflectivity coefficient. For a Lambertian material, this is typically 0.0.
      Specified by:
      getReflectivity in interface Material
      Returns:
      0.0

    • getIndexOfRefraction

      public double getIndexOfRefraction()
      Returns the index of refraction. For an opaque Lambertian material, this is typically 1.0.
      Specified by:
      getIndexOfRefraction in interface Material
      Returns:
      1.0

    • getTransparency

      public double getTransparency()
      Returns the transparency coefficient. For an opaque Lambertian material, this is typically 0.0.
      Specified by:
      getTransparency in interface Material
      Returns:
      0.0
